title: How to Recycle K Cups

steps.headline: Use the K Cup.
steps.description: Since a K Cup is a single-use beverage maker, use it once. You will want to clean the K Cup regardless of its final destination to prevent bacterial growth.

steps.headline: Remove the lid.
steps.description: The foil lid on top is punctured but not removed during the brewing process, so completely remove it.

steps.headline: Dispose of any remnants.
steps.description: There may be solids or liquids still inside the K Cup which need to be removed.

steps.headline: Wash and Rinse.
steps.description: With soap and water, clean out the K Cup to prevent bacterial growth. Then rinse to remove soap residue.

steps.headline: Allow to fully dry.
steps.description: Let air dry overnight to prevent bacterial growth.

steps.headline: Purchase a separator.
steps.description: These can be found online and in some stores. Due to the K Cup's three layers, it cannot be recycled without being separated.

steps.headline: Follow the directions.
steps.description: The most common K Cup Recycler, the Recycle A Cup, is very simple to use - just attach to the top, rotate, and pull up. Other Recyclers work almost identically.

steps.headline: Rinse off the layers.
steps.description: K Cups have three layers that protect the mix from the environment and are sometimes adhered together. A quick rinse in hot water should remove any adhesive that may be present.

steps.headline: Recycle.
steps.description: Now the fun part starts! There are a few options you have now;

steps.headline: Get Creative.
steps.description: Here are some ideas of ways to reuse a K Cup;
